knowledge.heading: Moral Education Through Experience
knowledge.description: The text demonstrates that true moral understanding develops through lived experience and personal mistakes rather than abstract instruction. Characters learn empathy and justice by confronting their own prejudices and witnessing real consequences of moral choices.
knowledge.pattern_connection: The retrospective narration shows how childhood experiences shape adult moral consciousness, with readers experiencing Scout's gradual awakening to ethical complexity.

device_examples.quote: My special knowledge of the Cunningham tribe—one branch, that is—was gained from events of last winter
device_examples.effect: Shows how past experience provides moral context that transforms innocent observation into ethical understanding.

device_examples.quote: I returned to school and hated Calpurnia steadily
device_examples.effect: Scout's honest admission reveals the petty emotions that must be overcome in moral development.
